author: pk910
content:
hmm,  there seems to be a problem with prysm nodes on devnet-8 right now.
the obvious one  is, that prysm-geth-1 & prysm-nethermind-1 are not following the chain right now ðŸ˜‰

apart from that I've also noticed that prysm does not process sync committee duties for the slot after a block with blobs arrived.
eg.: https://beaconlight-devnet8.pk910.de/epoch/4381
slot 140206 - 3 blobs, 100% sync contribution
slot 140207 - 0 blobs, 80% sync contribution (all prysm nodes missing)

looks like prysm needs too much time to process blocks with blobs?

author: pk910
content: <@363800010518822915> the blobs from 136257 are included in the follow up block 136258.

author: terencechain
content: ah interesting, thanks for the tips

author: barnabasbusa
content:
```time="2023-09-05 07:00:15" level=warning msg="Failed to save blob sidecar" error="nil or empty blob sidecars" prefix=initial-sync```
We are now outside the blob expiry window, so its possible that prysm is trying to fetch blobs that have expired. We have got one archive node on the network, and probably these nodes are not connected to it. I can try to manually add the enr of the archive node to all the prysm nodes, and see if it will sync back up.

author: barnabasbusa
content: ah it looks like hte issue persists for all prysm (execpt prysm-besu) pairs.
